intro: Felicia cymbalariae subsp. cymbalariae, commonly known as the common felicia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with prominent yellow centers and white petals, which bloom from spring to summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
